title: type in Andy Warhol classic Campbell's Soup painting
content:
Anyone know the what fonts are used for “condensed” & “soup”?  
Condensed might be “Copperplate”, but it’s hard to tell from this picture. Hopefully someone can verify this.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [campbells.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014548/http:/typophile.com/files/campbells.jpeg) | 71.89 KB |

 [‹ (x) Amour, gloire et beauté - House Chalet {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014548/http:/typophile.com/node/29353 "Go to previous forum topic") [CatManDo logo font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014548/http:/typophile.com/node/29324 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ill sans

comments.content:
Handcut by one of Warhol’s drones  
Condensed is similar to

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-gothic/")

Tim
